synopsis: Sets the CORS rules for a type of Storage service.

examples.title: Example 1: Assign CORS rules to the blob service
examples.code:
PS C:\>$CorsRules = (@{
AllowedHeaders=@("x-ms-blob-content-type","x-ms-blob-content-disposition");
AllowedOrigins=@("*");
MaxAgeInSeconds=30;
AllowedMethods=@("Get","Connect")},
@{
AllowedOrigins=@("http://www.fabrikam.com","http://www.contoso.com");
ExposedHeaders=@("x-ms-meta-data*","x-ms-meta-customheader");
AllowedHeaders=@("x-ms-meta-target*","x-ms-meta-customheader");
MaxAgeInSeconds=30;
AllowedMethods=@("Put")})
PS C:\> Set-AzureStorageCORSRule -ServiceType Blob -CorsRules $CorsRules
examples.remarks:
The first command assigns an array of rules to the $CorsRules variable. This command uses standard extends over several lines in this code block.
The second command assigns the rules in $CorsRules to the Blob service type.

examples.title: Example 2: Change properties of a CORS rule for blob service
examples.code:
PS C:\>$CorsRules = Get-AzureStorageCORSRule -ServiceType Blob
PS C:\> $CorsRules[0].AllowedHeaders = @("x-ms-blob-content-type", "x-ms-blob-content-disposition")
PS C:\> $CorsRules[0].AllowedMethods = @("Get", "Connect", "Merge")
PS C:\> Set-AzureStorageCORSRule -ServiceType Blob -CorsRules $CorsRules
examples.remarks:
The first command gets the current CORS rules for the Blob type by using the Get-AzureStorageCORSRule cmdlet. The command stores the rules in the $CorsRules array variable.
The second and third commands modify the first rule in $CorsRules.
The final command assigns the rules in $CorsRules to the Blob service type. The revised rules overwrite the current CORS rules.

parameters.name: ClientTimeoutPerRequest
parameters.description: Specifies the client-side time-out interval, in seconds, for one service request. If the previous call fails in the specified interval, this cmdlet retries the request. If this cmdlet does not receive a successful response before the interval elapses, this cmdlet returns an error.

parameters.name: ConcurrentTaskCount
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum concurrent network calls. You can use this parameter to limit the concurrency to throttle local CPU and bandwidth usage by specifying the maximum number of concurrent network calls. The specified value is an absolute count and is not multiplied by the core count. This parameter can help reduce network connection problems in low bandwidth environments, such as 100 kilobits per second. The default value is 10.

parameters.name: Context
parameters.description: Specifies an azure_2 Storage context. To obtain a context, use the New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.

parameters.name: CorsRules
parameters.description: Specifies an array of CORS rules. You can retrieve the existing rules using the Get-AzureStorageCORSRule cmdlet.

parameters.name: PassThru
parameters.description: Indicates that this cmdlet returns a Boolean that reflects the success of the operation. By default, this cmdlet does not return a value.

parameters.name: ServerTimeoutPerRequest
parameters.description: Specifies the length of the time-out period for the server part of a request.

parameters.name: ServiceType
parameters.description:
Specifies the azure_2 Storage service type for which this cmdlet assigns rules. psdx_paramvalues
-- Blob
-- Table
-- Queue
-- File

name: Set-AzureStorageCORSRule
description: The Set-AzureStorageCORSRule cmdlet sets the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for a type of azure_2 Storage service. The types of storage services for this cmdlet are Blob, Table, Queue, and File. This cmdlet overwrites the existing rules. To see the current rules, use the Get-AzureStorageCORSRule cmdlet.
